title: Slice notation can be more compact
body:
by **hugo.vincent**: 
Rather than 
buf[n:len(buf)]
I should be able to write
buf[n:len]
[or buf[n:len()] if it makes the parsing easier...]

I realize this is kind of a special case, but with long expressions it can
in fact make them a lot more compact and clear. 

An alternate would be to support Python-style buf[n:-1] notation, but I
don't think that is as clear.
